FK.content: that which acquiesces prior to all questioning of spirit: trust/faith, Faktum, comprehension of “is” or “be” > [Heidegger’s last god?] this faith does not constitute a religion but is it untouched by religiosity? [see p. 67]

HERP.content: Being is gathering (versammelt) [of the same]—logos > transitivity of “ist”: that it gathers
HERP.linkedContent: Being is gathering (versammelt) [of the same]—logos > transitivity of “ist”: that it gathers

HERP.content: Heidegger’s 3 experiences of hearing: 1) immortal, Erhören (hear, answer a prayer) 2) deaf ear (Überhören) of mortals 3) poet hears the ist, before or at origin of philosophy
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 experiences of hearing: 1) immortal, Erhören (hear, answer a prayer) 2) deaf ear (Überhören) of mortals 3) poet hears the ist, before or at origin of philosophy

HASD.content: veil (predicate) dissimulates & renders attractive at same time

VM.content: for Hegel, empiricism always forgets it uses the words “to be”; empiricism: thinking by metaphor w/out thinking the metaphor as such
VM.linkedContent: for Hegel, empiricism always forgets it uses the words “to be”; empiricism: thinking by metaphor w/out thinking the metaphor as such

VM.content: acc. Levinas, nonviolent language would not use “to be,” would not predicate, predication as 1st violence > only proper nouns: pure invocation, adoration [Derrida can’t see possibility of giving in Levinas’ vision, sees only slavery]

PP.content: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre
PP.linkedContent: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre

S.content: re: “Das Wesen der Sprache: Die Sprache des Wesens”—colon erases copula, allows question to be exceeded by pledge (consent to the address, en-gage), “is” would relaunch the question

OS.content: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness
OS.linkedContent: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness

SP.content: “moment sexual difference is determined as an opposition, the image of each term is inverted into the other” > the 2 X’s à la fois subject/predicate, their copula a mirror: man wants ideal man in woman, woman ideal woman in man > homosexual effacement à l’infini
SP.linkedContent: “moment sexual difference is determined as an opposition, the image of each term is inverted into the other” > the 2 X’s à la fois subject/predicate, their copula a mirror: man wants ideal man in woman, woman ideal woman in man > homosexual effacement à l’infini

ATIA.content: suis of Qui/Que suis-je? (both être and suivre) the little third party as copula, comes btwn subject and itself, worries it (s’acharne), hounds it, to hunt itself in the mirror

O.content: if nature is the book, how could there be both, don’t we have to decide btwn is and and, or find a mute conjunction to think book/nature together (cum) as set?
O.linkedContent: if nature is the book, how could there be both, don’t we have to decide btwn is and and, or find a mute conjunction to think book/nature together (cum) as set?

O.content: sense of fulfillment by way of copula (is) means nature is incomplete, needs a book to complete itself: closure of library articulates itself and turns on this hinge (gond): logic, rather graphics, of supplement
O.linkedContent: sense of fulfillment by way of copula (is) means nature is incomplete, needs a book to complete itself: closure of library articulates itself and turns on this hinge (gond): logic, rather graphics, of supplement

DPi.content: DP speaks in 3rd person present (can’t say: “I am no more”), copula signifies instantaneous passage from being to nothingness (“he is no more”): stigmē, Most High, Last Judgment, God’s verdict (always instant of death of a 3rd party, never me, you, us)
DPi.linkedContent: DP speaks in 3rd person present (can’t say: “I am no more”), copula signifies instantaneous passage from being to nothingness (“he is no more”): stigmē, Most High, Last Judgment, God’s verdict (always instant of death of a 3rd party, never me, you, us)

REST.content: when Shapiro says, “they are clearly pictures of the artist’s own shoes,” the copula (they are) couples the painted shoes to the painter’s feet, laces drawn out of picture, presupposes hole in canvas

REST.content: 2 capitalized attributes: adequate model (real shoes) & adequate subject (Van Gogh)

RM.content: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt

EJQB.content: the encounter (rencontre) is separation (breaks unity of Being by welcoming [accueillant] other into source of meaning) > contredit la “logique,” dans le fragile chaînon du “est”

EJQB.content: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now
EJQB.linkedContent: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now
